enDesc: Kitzur Sefer Haredim is a 19th-century abridgment of Rabbi Elazar Azcari’s Sefer Haredim, a 16th-century ethical-kabbalistic treatise. Kitzur Sefer-Haredim focuses on listing the commandments, unconventionally ordering them according to the body parts used in their performance. It was also called Mitzvat Moshe in its first publication, printed in the back of the author’s “Zichru Torat Moshe” on the laws of Shabbat.
enShortDesc: 19th-century work listing the commandments according to the body parts that perform them.
heShortDesc: חיבור מן המאה ה-19 המונה ומחלק את תרי״ג מצוות התורה על פי איברי הגוף הנדרשים לקיום כל מצווה.
